quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: John Hammond and Musician
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, musician. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: John Hammond is in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: John Hammonds sister, Alice Duckworth Hammond, was married to this good musician, who was a friend of Johns.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benny Goodman

questions.question: One of John Hammonds sons, John Paul Hammond, is a fine guitarist and composer. He wrote the  music to the Western Little Big Man. Who starred in this 1970 movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dustin Hoffman

questions.question: John Hammond was the main force in developing the career of Charley Christian. What was his main instrument?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: guitar

questions.question: John Hammond heard a really fine Kansas City -based band and immediately brought the band  to  New York and signed them to his record label. Whose band did he sign?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Count Basie

questions.question: John Hammond was a board member of this organization.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: NAACP

questions.question: In 1959 John Hammond signed to his label this Nigerian drummer who played traditional African music.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Babatunde Olatinji

questions.question: The last musician signed by John Hammond was a young guitarist from Texas. He was famous for his use of extra heavy guitar strings. His albums included Texas Flood, Soul to Soul, and The Sky Is Crying.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stevie Ray Vaughan

questions.question: In 1961John Hammond heard this Minnesota-born harmonica player on a record session and immediately signed him to his label.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Zimmerman

questions.question: At the time the second album of The Used came out, what three instruments could member Bert McCracken play?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Keyboard, piano, and trumpet.

questions.question: In the very early 1960s John Hammond signed a Canadian-born baritone singer/poet/author. Who is  this composer of Suzanne?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leonard Cohen

questions.question: In 1931 John Hammond signed his first musician to his record label. What was the name of this musician?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Garland Wilson

questions.question: In 1938 John Hammond was the producer of the first integrated music performance in a major US venue. What was the venue?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Yorks Carnegie Hall

questions.question: In 1938 John Hammond organized a series of concerts that promoted Black music. What was the  name of this famous series of concerts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: From Spirituals to Swing

questions.question: John Hammond never received a Grammy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Tina Turner and Album
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, vocalist, turner. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these tracks was included in Tina Turners album Private Dancer from 1984?

options.text: Whats Love Got to Do with It

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What was the name of Ike and Tina Turners band which was very successful in the 1960s and 1970s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ike  Tina Turner Revue

questions.question: What single by Ike and Tina Turner won a Grammy for Best RB Vocal Performance by a Duo in 1972?

options.text: I Want to Take You Higher

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Proud Mary

questions.question: Name Tina Turners autobiographical book, issued in 1986.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I, Tina

questions.question: Before joining The Used, Jepha Howard was vocalist in which band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Strange Itch

questions.question: Name Tina Turners debut solo album, released in 1974?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tina Turns the Country On

questions.question: During the recording of  the album In Love and Death by The Used, Kate, ex-girlfriend of band member Bert, died of an overdose.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Tina Turner born on November 26, 1939, in what state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tennessee

questions.question: Which one of the following singers was in a terrible car accident resulting in him being paralyzed for the rest of his life, until his passing in 2010?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teddy Pendergrass

questions.question: One of the following singers had a HUGE hit in 1989 called Here and Now. This was one of the biggest wedding songs of 1990.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luther Vandross

questions.question: What album did Tina Turner release after her separation from Ike Turner in 1978?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rough

questions.question: Finish the lyrics of Tina Turners song The Best: And it cant be wrong, take my heart and ...
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ...make it strong, baby.

questions.question: What did Tina Turner go by before assuming Tine Turner as her stage name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little Ann

questions.question: What is the name of Tina Turners first son, born in 1958?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Craig

questions.question: When Branden Steineckert, famous as drummer of The Used, was three years old, his father committed suicide.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barry White

questions.question: This singer gave us the hit song from 1977 called  Its Ecstasy When You Lay Down Next to Me.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barry White

questions.question: Brad Nowell was an honor roll student in high school.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What year was Sublimes first official (studio produced) album released?

questions.question: Brad Nowells beloved pet, Louie Dog, can be seen in a museum in Long Beach, CA.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Music and People
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, college, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who made this remark: Most rock journalism is people who cant write, interviewing people who cant talk, for people who cant read.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank Zappa

questions.question: This talented jazz musician, who died way too young, said: Music is your own experience, your own thoughts, your wisdom. If you dont live it, it wont come out of  your horn. They teach you theres a boundary line to music. But man, theres no boundary line to art.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlie Parker

questions.question: The following words regarding music were said by this great oboe player who had a popular TV show: Keep it simple, keep it sexy, keep it sad.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mitch Miller

questions.question: Who made this remark about music: Music makes one feel so romantic - at least it always gets on ones nerves-which is the same thing nowadays.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oscar Wilde

questions.question: What composer do these words belong to: Theres nothing magic about it. All you have to do is hit the right keys at the right time and the instrument plays itself.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johann Sebastian Bach

questions.question: What composer stated: Too many pieces of music finish  too long after the end.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Igor Stravinsky

questions.question: What European poet made this remark: The music at a wedding procession always reminds me of the music of soldiers going into battle.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heinrich Heine

questions.question: This musician said, I dont like country music, but I dont mean to denigrate those who do. And for those people who like  country music, denigrate means put  down.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Newhart

questions.question: Early in 2006, Dem Franchize Boyz had a feud with what other rap group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: D4L

questions.question: What author of fine plays and screenplays stated, If Beethoven had been killed in a plane crash at age 22 it  would have changed  the history of music ... and  of aviation.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Stoppard

questions.question: Which Dem Franchize Boyz member finished two semesters in college with a 3.0?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buddie

questions.question: What successful artist said: I dont want you to play me a riff thats going to impress Joe Satriani; give me a riff that makes a kid go out and buy a guitar and learn to play.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ozzie Osbourne

questions.question: What is the title of Dem Franchize Boyz first single?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White Tee

questions.question: Who rote the line If music be the food of love, play on?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shakespeare

questions.question: This person, often associated with Gonzo journalism, said, The music business is a cruel and shallow money trench, a long plastic hallway where thieves and pimps run free, and good men die like dogs. Theres also a negative side.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hunter S. Thompson

options.text: She was nicknamed after her favorite fictional character.
She had an imaginary friend called Dusty.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billie Holiday

options.text: Chaos is a friend of mine.
The amount of money one needs is terrifying.
I love Beethoven, especially the poems.
Life cant be all bad when for ten dollars you can buy all the Beethoven Sonatas and listen to them for ten years.

everything he said was a joke and its being published
hes going to play basketball with Michael Jordan
